entities.name: Navigation
entities.description: This tutorial illustrates the major features of navigation and routing inside SAPUI5 apps
samplesAsSteps: Catching invalid hashes similar to 'Not Found'
Adding a Back Button to the NotFound Page
Displaying a Target without changing the hash
Navigating to routes with hard coded patterns
Navigating to routes with mandatory parameters
Navigation to a page with a flip transition
Allowing bookmarkable tabs with optional query parameters
Assigning multiple targets to a route
Handling invalid hashes by listening for bypassed events
Listening for matched events of any route

entities.name: Data Binding
entities.description: In this tutorial, we will explain the concepts of data binding in SAPUI5
samplesAsSteps: Binding Paths â€“ Accessing Properties in Hierarchically Structured Models
Aggregation Binding Using A Factory Function

samples.name: Date Type - Source As Date
samples.description: This sample explains the formatting options of the date type with the date being available as date object.

samples.name: Date Type - Source As String
samples.description: This sample explains the formatting options of the date type with the date being available as string.

samples.name: DateTime Type - Source As Date
samples.description: This sample explains the formatting options of the datetime type.

samples.name: DateTime Type - Source As String
samples.description: This sample explains the formatting options of the datetime type.

samples.name: Time Type - Source As Time
samples.description: This sample explains the formatting options of the time type.

samples.name: FileSize Type
samples.description: This sample explains the formatting options of the filesize type.

samples.name: Data State
samples.description: A control can react on data state changes of a Binding and update it's states accordingly.

samples.name: OData Data State
samples.description: A control can react on data state changes of a Binding and update it's states accordingly.

samples.name: Control Busy Indicator
samples.description: A control's busy indicator can be used to block parts of the screen until an operation has finished. In this example we block the content of only one out of two panels.

samples.name: Field Groups
samples.description: A control's field group id can be used to define a virtual group of fields that should be validated together. Field groups can be validated usinf the ValidateFieldGroup event if the user presses the enter key in a field belonging to the field group or focusses a control outside of the field group.

samples.name: HTML
samples.description: With the HTML controls you can easily embed any kind of HTML content into your UI5 mobile application.

samples.name: Icon
samples.description: Built with an embedded font, icons scale well, and can be altered with CSS. They can also fire a press event. See the Icon Explorer for more icons.

samples.name: Integer Format
samples.description: Formats and parses only the integer digits. The decimal digits are ignored.

samples.name: Float Format
samples.description: Formats and parses both integer and decimal digits.

samples.name: Currency Format
samples.description: Formats the number by using the parameters defined for the given currency code. Either currency symbol, currency code or none of them can be included in the final formatted string. It parses the given string into an array which contains both the currency number and currency code.

samples.name: InvisibleText
samples.description: Many controls provide the associations ariaLabelledBy and ariaDescribedBy for accessibility purposes. The InvisibleText control can be used by application to provide hidden texts on the UI which can be referenced via these associations.

samples.name: Async View loading and rendering
samples.description: Example for Views with async source loading and the impact on rendering.

samples.name: Preprocessor example with XMLView
samples.description: A small example for View Preprocessor usage with XMLViews.

samples.name: XML Templating: demo scenario
samples.description: Complete demo scenario for XML Templating based on OData V4 annotations

samples.name: XML Templating: demo scenario extension
samples.description: Complete demo scenario for XML Templating based on OData V4 annotations incl. custom extensions

samples.name: XML Templating: minimal sample
samples.description: Minimal sample for XML Templating. BEWARE: This is meant to be a pure code sample. (To run it, you would need a proxy which is configured properly.)

samples.name: XML Templating: UI5 OData types
samples.description: XML Templating sample with UI5 core primitive OData types

samples.name: Separate Value List Loading
samples.description: Separate loading of value lists to reduce size of OData service metadata to be loaded

samples.name: Using Matchers
samples.description: Matchers are used to retrieve controls that have to match a condition, eg: Property matching a value

samples.name: Finding controls by id
samples.description: OPA finds a control by its id, triggers a tap and then finds multiple controls by their ids

samples.name: How to write nested actions
samples.description: If you have complex control structures you are able to add actions based on the result of previous actions.

samples.name: How to structure your OPA tests with Page Objects
samples.description: If you have multiple pages or UI areas that have several operations, you should place reuse functions in Page Objects to make your OPA tests maintainable. The example shows as well how to share and reuse functionality within and across page objects.

samples.name: Theme-dependent CSS-classes
samples.description: Sample display of 'sapTheme'-prefixed CSS classes for theme-dependent styling of custom HTML/Controls. The set displayed is to be used to style static HTML elements.

samples.name: Basic Theme Parameters
samples.description: This sample displays a set of basic theme parameters. Available in the predefined themes 'Blue Crystal' and 'High Contrast Black'. They can be used for custom HTML or custom controls to ensure theme-dependent styling. Please ensure a semantic correct usage.

samples.name: Route Patterns
samples.description: Syntax for the Route pattern property.

samples.name: Targets without a Router
samples.description: If you do not need bookmarks, a router is too complicated you can use Targets to lazy load your views and navigate through your application.

samples.name: Routing between Fullscreen pages a simple sample
samples.description: A mini app with 2 pages. Both are bookmarkable.

samples.name: Binding Path
samples.description: Checks if a control has a binding context with the exact same binding path
